this: :core:chaincode:shim:java   seems to me some path from fabric repo (not the sdk)

<@U1AU8DRQR> tell me one thing do we need fabric-javaenv and fabric-ccenv image to run java-sdk ?
maybe for the build?
not sure
okay so these images should be run using docker-compose or not ?

e.g. for deploy TXs there is a line:
./src/main/java/org/hyperledger/fabric/sdk/transaction/DeployTransactionBuilder.java:			return new String(SDKUtil.readFileFromClasspath("Go.Docker"));

and in that file 
./src/main/resources/Go.Docker:FROM hyperledger/fabric-ccenv
I guess they are automatically run
fabric-ccenv seems to be used for deployment

btw to reproduce follow following steps:-

Download following docker images:-

hyperledger/fabric-baseimage
hyperledger/fabric-peer
hyperledger/fabric-javaenv
hyperledger/fabric-ccenv
hyperledger/fabric-membersrvc

checkout following link:-

<https://hub.docker.com/r/hyperledger/>
all images are of v0.6.1-perview and baseimage is v0.2.1
tag all images with latest tag
and what to do with them then?

<@U0KMJF9AA|vikasjakhar> has joined the channel

hy all, i am running fabric-java-sdk test cases and chaincode build was successful but no jar file is created
can anyone help me to resolve the problem ?

btw have to make some changes to make build successful, created one file settings.gradle with following content:-

include ':core:chaincode:shim:java'
project(':core:chaincode:shim:java').projectDir = new File(settingsDir, '../core/chaincode/shim/java/')

and changed gradle build command in java.Docker file as following:-

RUN cd /root/chaincode && gradle -b build.gradle -c settings.gradle build --info
<@U0YNFB22X> can help, maybe
